title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Roman pasta dish with crispy guanciale, eggs, and pecorino romano. Simple ingredients combined into something magical.
steps: Bring a large pot of well-salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut guanciale into small strips and cook in a cold pan over medium heat until crispy and fat has rendered, about 8 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, whole eggs, and most of the pecorino. Season generously with black pepper.
When pasta is ready, reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain. Remove guanciale pan from heat.
Add hot pasta to the guanciale pan, toss to coat in fat. Let cool for 30 seconds.
Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing constantly. Add splashes of pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with remaining pecorino and more black pepper.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: Aromatic and creamy Thai curry with tender chicken and vegetables in a fragrant coconut sauce.
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons of the thick coconut cream in a wok over medium-high heat until it splits.
Add green curry paste and fry until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add chicken and stir-fry until sealed on all sides.
Pour in remaining coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Add eggplant and bamboo shoots. Cook for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce and sugar. Adjust to taste.
Stir in Thai basil just before serving. Serve over jasmine rice with chili and lime.

title: Classic Buttermilk Pancakes
description: Fluffy, golden pancakes perfect for a lazy weekend breakfast. Light and tender with a slight tang from the buttermilk.
steps: Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir until just combined. Lumps are okay - don't overmix!
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Lightly butter the surface.
Pour about 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form and edges look set, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with maple syrup, fresh berries, or your favorite toppings.

title: Beef Tacos with Fresh Salsa
description: Flavorful seasoned beef in warm tortillas topped with homemade fresh salsa, creamy avocado, and zesty lime.
steps: Make the salsa by combining tomatoes, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and set aside.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion until softened, about 4 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground beef, breaking it up with a spoon. Cook until browned.
Stir in cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add a splash of water if needed.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or directly over a gas flame.
Assemble tacos with meat, salsa, avocado, sour cream, and queso fresco.

title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: Luxuriously creamy Italian rice dish with earthy mushrooms and parmesan. Worth every minute of stirring.
steps: Heat stock in a saucepan and keep warm over low heat.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over high heat. Sauté mushrooms until golden, about 5 minutes. Season and set aside.
In the same pan, melt half the butter. Cook shallot until soft, add garlic for 30 seconds.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes, stirring to coat in butter.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm stock one ladle at a time, stirring frequently. Wait until each addition is mostly absorbed before adding more.
After about 18 minutes, rice should be creamy but still have a slight bite.
Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter, parmesan, and most of the mushrooms.
Serve topped with reserved mushrooms and fresh thyme.

title: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Perfectly chewy cookies with crisp edges and melty chocolate chips. A timeless classic that never disappoints.
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Whisk flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Beat butter and both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Mix in vanilla.
Gradually add flour mixture, mixing on low until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips by hand.
Scoop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared sheets, spacing 5cm apart.
Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are golden but centers look slightly underdone.
Let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

title: Classic Greek Salad
description: Fresh and vibrant Mediterranean salad with juicy tomatoes, crisp cucumber, tangy feta, and kalamata olives.

ingredients.name: large ripe tomatoes, cut into chunks

steps: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and bell pepper in a large bowl.
Add olives and scatter feta on top.
Whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad just before serving.
Toss gently at the table. Serve with crusty bread.

title: Quick Chicken Stir-Fry
description: A fast and healthy weeknight dinner loaded with colorful vegetables and tender chicken in a savory sauce.
steps: Mix all sauce ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking.
Add chicken in a single layer. Let it sear without moving for 1 minute, then stir-fry until cooked. Remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed. Stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli and carrot, stir-fry 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and snap peas, cook another 2 minutes.
Return chicken to the wok. Pour in sauce and toss until everything is coated and sauce thickens.
Serve immediately over steamed rice or noodles.

title: Moist Banana Bread
description: The best way to use overripe bananas. Incredibly moist, naturally sweet, and perfect with a cup of coffee.
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
Mix in melted butter, then sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Sprinkle baking soda and salt over the mixture, stir to combine.
Add flour and mix until just incorporated. Fold in walnuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 55-65 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack.

title: Tom Yum Soup
description: Hot and sour Thai soup bursting with aromatic herbs, juicy shrimp, and mushrooms. Warming and incredibly flavorful.
steps: Bring stock to a boil in a pot. Add lemongrass, lime leaves, galangal, and chilies.
Simmer for 5 minutes to infuse the aromatics.
Add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and chili paste.
Taste and adjust seasoning - it should be sour, salty, and spicy.
Ladle into bowls, garnish with cilantro. Serve immediately.
